intro: Epilobium × erroneum, commonly known as the hybrid willow herb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the genus Epilobium, which includes various species of flowering plants in the evening primrose family (Onagraceae). The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as riverbanks, wet meadows, and roadside ditches. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
